tn.ref: a lofty residence
tn.text: AT: "an exalted place to live" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: all the assembly of Israel was standing
tn.text: AT: "while the people stood" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])

tn.ref: has fulfilled it with his own hands
tn.text: has caused it to happen or has ensured that his promises were fulfilled (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])

tn.ref: in order for my name to be there
tn.text: AT: "In order to make myself known there." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: in the heart of David
tn.text: AT: "a desire of David. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: for the name of Yahweh
tn.text: Yahweh's name represented His total presence. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: in which is Yahweh's covenant
tn.text: AT: "in which are the stone tablets showing the covenant that Yahweh made with us Israelite people." (UDB)

tn.ref: in the presence of all the assembly of Israel
tn.text: AT: "in front of the people of Israel who had gathered there."

tn.ref: cubits
tn.text: (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bdistance]])

tn.ref: he spread out his hands toward the heavens
tn.text: Solomon lifted up his hands and held them high as he knelt on the platform to pray.

tn.ref: servants who walk before you with all their heart
tn.text: AT: "us who genuinely try to do what you want us to do. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: you spoke with your mouth and have fulfilled it with your hand
tn.text: This refers to the promise that God made to David that his son would build the temple. AT: "you have fulfilled your promise." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: carry out
tn.text: This is a request. AT: "please do"

tn.ref: You will not fail to have a man in my sight to sit on the throne of Israel
tn.text: AT: "you will always have one of David's descendants as king" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])

tn.ref: as you have walked before me
tn.text: AT: "in the way that David did" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: But will God actually live with mankind on the earth?
tn.text: AT: "But God, surely you will not actually live with mankind on the earth." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: the entire universe and heaven itself
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:2ch:02:06|2:6]].

tn.ref: listen to the cry and prayer
tn.text: The words "cry" and "prayer" share similar meanings. Together they emphasize the earnestness of his prayer. AT: "please answer my earnest request." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: May your eyes be open toward this temple day and night
tn.text: "Please help those who come to you in the temple, at any time—day or night" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: where you promised to put your name
tn.text: AT: "where you said you would make people know you"

tn.ref: your servant prays toward this place
tn.text: The writer prays in the direction of the Temple.

tn.ref: when you listen, forgive
tn.text: AT: "when you hear the prayers, please forgive their sin"

tn.ref: to bring his conduct on his own head
tn.text: AT: "by punishing him as he deserves to be punished" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: please listen from the heavens and
tn.text: AT: "Please, honor their prayer" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: you gave to them
tn.text: AT: "you promised to them"

tn.ref: When the skies are shut up and there is no rain
tn.text: The phrase "the skies are shut up" means that no rain falls from the sky. AT: "When you do not allow any rain to fall." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: confess your name
tn.text: With their words and by their actions, they honor God and His authority. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: turn from their sin
tn.text: AT: stop their evil ways"

tn.ref: direct them to the good way in which they should walk
tn.text: AT: "show them how to live righteously"

tn.ref: each knowing the plague and sorrow in his own heart
tn.text: Possible meanings are: "knowing the sin in his own heart" or "knowing in his heart that the plague and sorrow are the result of his own sin."

tn.ref: he spreads out his hands
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:2ch:06:12|6:12]]

tn.ref: all his ways
tn.text: AT: "what he has done"

tn.ref: your great name, your mighty hand, and your outstretched arm
tn.text: AT: "you are very great and powerful" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: called by your name
tn.text: AT: "known as the house of Yahweh, your possession."

tn.ref: I have built
tn.text: AT: "The people have built under my leadership" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_hypo]]

tn.ref: the enemy carries them away and takes them as captives to their land
tn.text: the enemy takes them as captives and brings them to the land of their enemies"

tn.ref: pray toward their land
tn.text: This refers to Israel. AT: "and pray facing this land that you gave their ancestors,"

tn.ref: let your eyes be open, and let your ears be attentive
tn.text: AT: please see us and listen" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
